column4: got a problem - i just installed hoary and everything was working fine. then i ran Synaptic updates and now my machine won't boot. gets as far as uncompressing the kernel, then automatically reboots. i don't know what the problem could be. any idea?
have you tried with the previous kernel images in the boot list
there aren't any previous kernel images in the menu, unfortunately
i'm just wondering if it could perhaps be a hardware issue
it could indeed, but more likely is that hoary just fucked up :)
you could always boot up using the live cd, chroot to your installation and try upgrading again
or at least you could look at bootup logs
oh but it probably doesn't get far enough to even start loggin?
logging
yup. there won't be a boot log, and i already tried the live cd and chroot thing, but it did the same thing
bugger. do you have /home on a separate partition?
yep. sure do
hmm. it may not be the kernel itself, cos it crashes at the uncompressing stage. could it be a grub issue?
kill the bastard, and just reinstall and hope for the best? :)
if you suspect that, put the livecd in and boot up using the boot menu on the cd?
unfortunately, that's what i've just done! i had installed previously, but a similar thing happened, and i've just got around to reinstalling tonight :(
i can boot from the live cd ok
no, but as in boot from the live cd using the initrd and kernel image from your hd?
the boot cd has grub, too? or is it isolinux or the like? then that probably doesn't work, or am not sure how
hmm. not sure if i'd be able to boot from the hd using the live cd
grub has to know where the kernel image lives
yes, but have you noticed you can edit those things on the fly when booting up? the place that's used as root, the lpace where initrd is, the kernel image and so oin
right. ok. but wouldn't i need to know the exact location on the hard disk?
